com.github.clemp6r.futuroid

Class Async

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.clemp6r.futuroid.Async

  • public class Async
extends Object
    Utility class for submitting asynchronous tasks and creating Futures.

    Sample asynchronous method: 
     public Future<User> findUser(long id) {
     return Async.submit(new Callable<User>() {
         public User call() {
             return dao.findUser(id);
         }
     });
 }
    Example usage of such service in UI client code: 
     findUser(id).addCallback(new FutureCallback<User>() {
     public void onSuccess(User user) {
         displayUserInfo(user);
     }

     public void onFailure(Throwable t) {
         showErrorDialog(t);
     }
 });

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultExecutorService

        public static void setDefaultExecutorService(ExecutorService executor)
        Replaces the default executor service by the given one.

      • submit

        public static <T> Future<T> submit(Callable<T> task)
        Submits a value-returning task for execution and returns a Future representing the pending results of the task. The task will be run using the default executor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        task - the task to submit
        Returns:
        a Future representing pending completion of the task

      • submit

        public static <T> Future<T> submit(Callable<T> task,
                   ExecutorService executor)
        Submits a value-returning task for execution and returns a Future representing the pending results of the task. The task will be run on the provided executor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result type
        Parameters:
        task - the task to submit
        executor - an ExecutorService that will be used to run the task
        Returns:
        a Future representing pending completion of the task

      • immediate

        public static <T> Future<T> immediate(T result)
        Creates a Future which has its value set immediately upon construction.
        Parameters:
        result - the Future result

      • immediateFail

        public static <T> Future<T> immediateFail(Throwable t)
        Creates a Future which has an exception set immediately upon construction.

      • all

        public static Future<Object[]> all(Future... futures)
        Returns a future holding the results of all provided futures. Results are returned in the same order as the futures.
